title: Method for Determining Standard Deviation
text: Since the table gives us the difference from the sample mean to the midpoint $$(m-x)$$, we can actually use the formula sqrt((sum{}{}{f*(m-x)**2})/(n-1)). Essentially, in words, this means that we want to find the square root of the summation of the product of frequency by the squared difference from the mean.

title: Determine the Sample Standard Deviation
text: What is the sample standard deviation? Round to the nearest hundredth.

subHints.title: Determine the Sample Standard Deviation
subHints.text: What is $$\sqrt{\frac{43.2964}{26-1}}$$ rounded to the nearest hundredth?
